Mostly clear PERIOD Low near 35F PERIOD Winds light and variable PERIOD

Updated November     pm



The Gold team topped the Black team  in the annual spring game thanks to a 14point fourth quarter Saturday PERIOD

The Gold team composed of the firstteam defense and secondteam offense was led by the legs of sophomore running back Dan Dierking the arms of quarterbacks Joey Elliott and Justin Siller and an aggressive stingy defense PERIOD

 coach Joe Tiller said following the game PERIOD 

With a  lead thanks to a pair of touchdown passes by Elliott the Gold squad controlled nearly the entire first half until the  mark of the second quarter when senior running back Jaycen Taylor ran  yards for a Black team touchdown PERIOD

On the next play following the extra point freshman cornerback Mike Conway tied the game by picking off Siller and returning it  yards for another quick touchdown PERIOD

After putting up  points in the first half for the Gold team Elliott replaced senior quarterback Curtis Painter on the Black team PERIOD Painter who sat out the second half finished 11for19 for  yards PERIOD Elliott was 21for27 passing for  yards on the day PERIOD

The third quarter finished scoreless but the Gold team got back on top in the fourth quarter after Siller and freshman fullback Jared Crank hooked up for a 3yard touchdown reception PERIOD Siller who played mostly in the second half finished 8for14 with two scores and one interception PERIOD

With  remaining in the contest the Gold team put the game away after Siller tossed the ball into the hands of Dierking giving the Gold a twotouchdown advantage PERIOD

 Dierking said PERIOD 

Dierking who led all rushers with  yards on  carries proved tough to bring down all day as he shed numerous tacklers PERIOD

 Tiller said PERIOD 

On the other side of the ball Gold team linebackers Kevin Green and Jason Werner combined for  tackles and three pass breakups PERIOD

The Boilermakers will open the  season against Northern Colorado on Sept PERIOD  at RossAde Stadium PERIOD
